questions.question: What is federalism?
options: A system of government where power is divided between a central authority and constituent political units.
A system where all powers are held by a central government.
A system that promotes a single party rule.
questions.answer: A system of government where power is divided between a central authority and constituent political units.

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of federalism?
In a federal system, which level of government has the power to legislate on subjects in the Concurrent List?
